title: [caffe2] caffe2 install tutorial error: no module named hypothesis, cannot import_name caffe2_pb2
body_html:
In relu_op_test.py,
from hypothesis import given, so we should pip install hypothesis first, but

the tutorial doesn't say anything about hypothesis.


When I cd pytorch and python caffe2/python/operator_test/relu_op_test.py, it has the error "cannot import_name caffe2_pb2".
I modify PYTHONPATH several times, it doesn't work. At last, I use the command
python pytorch/caffe2/python/operator_test/relu_op_test.py and it works. So why relu_op_test.py can not find caffe2_pb2 in current path?
Please update the tutorial(it confused me long) tutorial
body_text:
In relu_op_test.py,
from hypothesis import given, so we should pip install hypothesis first, but

the tutorial doesn't say anything about hypothesis.

When I cd pytorch and python caffe2/python/operator_test/relu_op_test.py, it has the error "cannot import_name caffe2_pb2".
I modify PYTHONPATH several times, it doesn't work. At last, I use the command
python pytorch/caffe2/python/operator_test/relu_op_test.py and it works. So why relu_op_test.py can not find caffe2_pb2 in current path?
Please update the tutorial(it confused me long) tutorial
body:
In relu_op_test.py,
 `from hypothesis import given`, so we should **pip install hypothesis first**, but 
![175](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17454232/42611262-d594d114-85c7-11e8-8bb8-0fa34bfdcaf3.png)
the tutorial doesn't say anything about hypothesis.

![176](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17454232/42611312-02076a9a-85c8-11e8-8302-773ec6672341.png)
When I `cd pytorch` and `python caffe2/python/operator_test/relu_op_test.py`, it has the error **"cannot import_name caffe2_pb2".**
I modify PYTHONPATH several times, it doesn't work. At last, I use the command                           
`python pytorch/caffe2/python/operator_test/relu_op_test.py` and it works. **So why relu_op_test.py can not find caffe2_pb2 in current path?** 
Please update the tutorial(it confused me long) [tutorial](https://caffe2.ai/docs/getting-started.html?platform=ubuntu&configuration=compile)
